Reviews.Title: “A little tooooooo far out for me...”
Reviews.Author: cathatsha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with a Theatre trip in mind. Personally it was away from the main hub of the west end as you would have to use the Tube to get into Central London. Providing the lines were working!. Sadly the weekend we were there we had to bus it every where, as the tube station was having a 'makeover' in time for the Olympics, however in discussion with some locals, it is a regular occurance. With the traffic in London being what it is, and everyone having to use the links to get around, you were uncomfortably sardined, in a slow moving bus, other than sardined on the fast moving tube. Camden Market seemed like a ride to hell from there. In regards to the hotel, it is down a side street, away from everything other than a railway line directly behind the place, and a backstreet shortcut for cars directly in front. Both operational 24 hrs. The breakfast looks wonderful in the well placed menu's, and they advertise 'between 7 and 11" however stroll down at 9 And you are lucky to have cereal, and the last baked bean in the dish. Well stocked it isnt. There is a vending machine in the foyer for drinks snacks, though as per usual, overpriced. I wouldn't stay here again, due to its locality, and proximity to the railway line. The extra cost you lay out getting around, you may as well put toward a more central, better class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but be aware DLR line and traffic.”
Reviews.Author: Haraldsenb
Reviews.Content: My second Travelodge hotel in this area, and same story once again. If your a light sleeper and wake up by the smallest sound, this is not a hotel for you. DLR line passes right next to the hotel. I tought that the traffic would`nt be any problem in the small street in front of the hotel, but it was some traffic. My advice is to ask for a room towards the street. We tough slept as babies. Travelodge is a safe, cheap and clean choice. Very close to Tower Bridge and the underground. Some nice pubs just around the corner. Staff was very friendly and that pizza is good after a night out. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ilmatto
Reviews.Content: We booked a bit in advance, so this granted a good price. And price was mainly the reason that brought me here, as long as the standard travelodge quality. It is quite near the Aldgate East Underground station, so it's pretty easy to reach most of London from here, even if it's not in the very centre. It was my second staying here, and I enjoyed my clean room, in which I basically slept at night as we were out visiting London all day long. The people at reception were kind and helped me when I asked them.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean & basic - avoid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: maity1607
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, the rooms are clean and basic but sufficient and we slept well. Power shower very much appreciated. Would highly recommend the Princess of Prussia pub on Prescott Street (runs parallel) it is quirky, warm abd welcoming with an ecclectic jukebox and clientel. The lager and wine were nice and reasonably priced for London. breakfast was terrible and very expensive but only choice if you want to eat before 9.30 at the weekend - if staying mon-fri the Wetherspoons on Prescott Street would be a much better bet. I would stop at Travelodge again but would bring cereal bars with me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and the staff were great”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and it was great. We asked for a room away from the railway line and above ground level which we were given without a problem. It was very quiet, clean and modern. We had breakfast and a meal in the bar - both of which were good value. We accessed the hotel from Chambers Street and so didn't need to go under the viaduct. Using this route, Aldgate East is about 5 mins away and gives you access to Hammersmith & City as well as the District Line. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and pubs around this area and not far from Brick Lane. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Travelodge I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyr28
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Travelodge Aldgate East and found it to be a very modern hotel. It is in a great location, 5 minute walk from Aldgate East Underground. I didn't ever have problems with the alley way because I never walked down that way. The hotel staff were lovely, had a friendly greeting on arrival, no problems checking in. Stayed on the third floor, and our room was a twin room with a lovely bathroom. The room was clean and also cleaned every morning I was there with fresh towels etc. The room was warm and had a flatscreen TV. I stayed at the weekend and there were no noises from the road that I noticed but on the Monday morning there were deliveries to the hotel and that woke me up a few times and you can hear the trains every now and then so if you're a light sleeper maybe ask for a room on another side of the hotel. Even the noise didn't bother me to be honest and it is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. I always read horror stories on these review sites and I've never had a bad experience with travelodge. This hotel is a really great place to stay and in a great location. Would happily go back if I visit London again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: AD1973
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms to accommodate the family. Rooms clean and modern with tasteful decor. No noise issues. 5 minutes or so walk from 3 tube stations. Wetherspoons around the corner great for breakfast. No problem with walking down the 'dark alley' over reviewers had mentioned, you are only in it for 30 seconds and it is well lit with quite a bit of traffic passing through and a 24hour car wash at either end. Only problem was hot water at about 6pm but available at other times. For what I paid, it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!”
Reviews.Author: roseriddles
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend has allways stayed in a travel lodge in london.So we didnt think we would have a problem at this one.Once arriving the hotel looked clean and the lady on the reception was nice.Got to our room on the first floor facing the road which i was glad as at the back of the building is a railway line..was i wrong!next to our room was a noisy 24 hour carwash!our room was basic,but HUMAN BLOOD stains on the curtains and stains on walls and carpet!they gave us a old heater which could of blew up but straightaway a member of staff got us a new heater!My friend ended up having a cold shower and the room was cold even with a heater so we asked if we could have another room and was told the hotel was full(we did not see anyone).So we had three hours sleep and checked out at 7 in the morning and it ended up ruining our trip to london and ended up having to pay extra to get home early.The only good bit of this hotel was the girl on the reception and the bed and tv..Dont ask to see a manager as so one seems to be inchange!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: isweetieangel23
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in London. Room clean and comfortable. Bed very comfy so slept like a dream. Staff very helpful and the free Wi Fi in the reception an added bonus. Good location for getting around London. The near bye Red Chilli Indian restaurant over the road is good too. Good Travelodge, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - no major complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Divabiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property from the 9th - 22nd January 2012. At the time of booking it was the only hotel that had a tv & ensuite in the bedroom & that was situated within short walking distance from a zone 1 tube station in my price range & so even though I had seen a number of negative reviews on it I still decided to take the chance & so I booked. As I continued to read reviews up until my arrival I was a little nervous considering just how negative many of them were. I was considering cancelling my room there due to this but didn't want to lose the money. I am so glad that I didn't cancel! :) I booked my room online for 32 pounds a night (great deal!) & then called the hotel to confirm. I arrived on the 9th of January in a shuttle transfer bus from Heathrow Airport...I have to say that the bus driver simply had no clue where the hotel was & it wasn't showing up on the GPS but as I had an idea of the area I told him to drive by the other travelodge (Tower Hill...it is literally 5 min walk from Aldgate East travelodge)...we went in & got directions & then it was smooth from there. At reception I was greeted by an exceptionally friendly young man at the desk who efficiently checked me in & asked me if I needed any help with anything. He said to always let reception know if I needed a taxi or a theatre ticket or directions etc...they were more than willing to help. Reception area is clean & has leather couches. There is also free water in reception to freshen up with after a long journey. I was given room number 416 (facing apartments on the Chamber Street road side not the Railways tracks). I had asked for a top floor room that was relatively quiet & this is what I got. When the window is closed you can't hear a thing. When the window is open however I could hear the trains from behind the hotel but this was nothing major. Could also hear cars & sirens but again...not to a large extent. I imagine rooms on the railway track side would be slightly noisier but again...I can't imagine this would be too difficult to get over if you are tired enough. The room was heated to a wonderful degree. I was able to sleep comfortable in the room with just the one blanket on. The lighting in the room was excellent. I was dissapointed to see that there was just a shower but no bath but considering that I was paying such a small amount this did not bother me. The bathroom is a reasonable size. The shower I have to say wasn't the hottest...the water pressure was good however. Whilst they do not provide toiletries they do provide a small bar of soap in the bathroom which is good. There is a cupboard & large desk & chair in the room as well as a fan. The tv was very clear...had the basic channels you would expect. The Bed itself - Clean and comfortable...the pillows were good too so I don't understand why people complain about them. I was given 4 pillows! The Cleaners - All the cleaners that I came into contact with were friendly. I will say that none of them had particularly good english skills & even though I did once request they not enter my room, I did come home that day to find the sheets had been changed but again...not a huge issue. Their language skills weren't 100% but they were friendly & efficient. The hotel itself: The hallways are rather narrow so if you try to get through the hallway with a large bag whilst the cleaners are there - forget it... I quickly found that out after the first attempt. The hotel in general is quite clean & friendly looking though. The staff throughout the 2 weeks there were all smiley & friendly....received great service & had a good joke or two with them. The Area: I am a single female traveller from Australia who is only 20 yrs old...after reading the reviews about Chamber Street...again, I was nervous. But guess what? I walked through those arches & under the tunnel almost every night that I was there well after 10pm each time & I felt 100% safe & wasn't scared at all. There are car washes all along the arches & the men in there are always smiley & friendly & would give me a wave at night to let me know it was all ok. If you have seen EastEnders...just think of Phil's place & the Arches...it's like that. Wasn't scared at all. The hotel is within 5-10 min walking distance from both Aldgate East station & Tower Hill station & there are 4 lines (district, circle, hammersmith & city, metropolitan) that run from these stations so that you have easy access to the centre of London. Again, very simple to get to the stations. There is a Tesco less than 5 min walk from the hotel. There is a Waitrose about 10 min walk from the hotel. On Whitechapel High St (5 mins walk from hotel....next to Aldgate East station) there is an Internet Cafe (exit Aldgate East station via Whitechapel Gallery Exit) that charges 50p for 30 mins which is quite good value. There is also a pub, KFC, Burger King & Costa Coffee next to the station. In Leman street (next to Chamber St) there are 2 Indian Restaurants, a Lebanese Restaurant, a Pub (The Brown Bear), a Bar further up the street (The Oliver Conquest) & a little Fried Chicken/Kebab takeaway shop that sells a huge Cod & Chips for 4 pounds - great value! I can't say that I ate at all in the restaurant of the hotel so I cannot review that but unless you really want to eat in the hotel I would say go elsewhere as there is plenty about. The hotel does lock the front door at 10pm but you can enter by putting your room card in the door. Very simple & safe. As this is the East End...I recommend visiting Commercial Road (which is 10-15 min walk from the hotel)....it is full of Indian/Pakistani & Arab restaurants & shops. I loved it. I would not hesitate to stay here again & I am sure that I will on my next trip to London. I can't understand the complaints of some reviewers here. I understand if you are paying a lot of money at the last minute that you might be dissapointed with it but seriously...it's great value for London. Personally, I actually have stayed at the Ritz & I have to say...for what you pay here...it's fantastic value!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, better than expected after reading reviews”
Reviews.Author: bglad2uk
Reviews.Content: First of all, when we book the Travelodge, we are not expecting five-star treatment. Indeed, after reading some reviews on here (after booking this room in one of the sales at a very, very cheap price), I was having doubts as to whether I should not instead forget it and book somewhere else. I am glad I didn't. Sure, it is not a luxurious establishment, but I have no complaints at all. My bed was suitably comfortable, the room was clean and there was hot water almost instantly, and consistently in the shower. My room looked over Chamber Street (where this is located) so it was on the opposite side to the railway lines so maybe this ensured reduced noise, however a cleaning lorry did wake me up when it passed in the early hours; that can happen anywhere in a big city, though. I was even pleasantly surprised with my welcome at reception. I arrived around midnight and the member of staff was very courteous and there was a jug of water and cups available to help myself if I needed refreshment. Check-out was swift and I was asked with a smile if I had enjoyed my stay and whether there was anything they could improve. I thought not - this is a Travelodge and, in terms of what I expect Travelodges to offer, I found this one exceeded my expectations and I would not hesitate booking here again if I am looking for cheap yet clean and comfy accommodation in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: BCKL78
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. 3rd floor single room. Spartan accommodations but very clean. Bring your own facecloth and all toiletries. I was not bothered by the adjacent train but if you are a light sleeper don't stay here. Prepaid breakfast was a good value and the lobby had free wifi for planning your day. 5 min walk to Aldgate East tube or Tower Gateway rail station. At least 4 decent pubs and a few good restaurants within 5 min walk. It's not the Ritz, but if you're looking for a cheap clean room to sleep and shower in and you're Ok with not being in the center of everything but close to transport to everything then I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “London Visit”
Reviews.Author: Declan_01
Reviews.Content: We were attending a Christmas party in London and were looking for something central but cheap and this hotel meet both expectations. We phoned about a week beforehand to request an early check in (the Â£10 deal that Travelodge offers). We arrived at the hotel at 12 and we only had to wait about 5 minutes for the room to be ready. Check in was quick and friendly. The reception area, bar and cafe/restaurant was all very clean and modern. The room was also the same. I am not too sure when the hotel was opened, but it is all very new. The hotel is well located to Aldgate, Aldagte East and Tower Hill tube stations and Tower Gateway DLR station. Overall for just under Â£39 this hotel was excellent value and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Why are some people scared of everything that is not designer!”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: We found the Aldgate East very comfortable, very clean and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food: but the thing that pleased us most was the courtesy and friendliness of the staff. They were very amenable and went out of their way to help us when they could. Thanks to Dominika and others for the lovely breakfasts and everyone else, from the cleaners to the reception staff. It's very handy for the DLR, Tower Bridge and the Tower of London and only 30mins (daytime) 10mins (night) by bus (No. 15 near tube station) from Covent Garden. Easy tube access. I've read ''julieslegs'' review opposite and I think that nails it. Nothing at all to be afraid of near the arches: It's just like 'Phil & Grant's'' garage in Eastenders! After leaving the hotel I had an accident on the pavement and two of those lads from the arches were out like a flash patching me up and looking after me. Really nice people. I think if I'd have had the same mishap on the other side near the City gents I'd still be lying there! If we were visiting that area of London again I would definitely stay there again - and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as some reviews make you believe.”
Reviews.Author: julieslegs
Reviews.Content: Difficult hotel to review is this as a lot of other reviews are quite negative but Iâ€™ll try and give my opinion on what appear to be the major talking points. Firstly the location. Its inbetween whats the â€œCityâ€� and the start of suburban East London. About 5 mins from either Tower hill or Aldgate east tube station depending on your preference. The DLR station of Tower Gateway was also minutes away. The Tower Hill side is dominated by the City boys in their suits, the Aldgate east side is simply London. A lot of reviews mention Chamber st and the railway arches. We found no problems under the arches what so ever. There were two 24/7 car wash garages underneath and judging by their punters expensive cars there canâ€™t be too much wrong with this area. It wasnâ€™t dark or intimidating and I walk around far Worse Street in my home town. If this street scares you then so will every other street in London. Surrounding the infamous arches are a Premier Inn and another travel lodge and Tesco and a Weatherspoon pub. Not really the hang-outs of a wanabe mugger. If your still put off by the arches then next to the Prem Inn is Magdalene passage which is 20 metres long and fetchâ€™s you out more or less outside this Travelodge. Inside the hotel the lobby area is immaculate. A decent size eating area and small bar(24 hour).Staff all friendly and helpful. We had small check in prob as they couldnâ€™t find our reservation but luckily weâ€™d printed confirmation of booking. Not sure how they would of handled had we not had this. The room was an unusual shape for bog standard Travelodge(longer not square) and the carpets were barely tacked to floor so it suggests this was a previous chain hotel quickly converted to Travelodge standard decor. Room was clean, larger than usual London travel lodges and pleasant enough. The shower was fine but if youâ€™re fussy the water did have a habit of giving you a cold blast occasionally but nothing to get worked up about. The odd numbered rooms overlook the railway line running unto Tower Gateway. Itâ€™s true you can hear the trains BUT itâ€™s not that noisy.Theres a slight rumbling sound but we sort of got used to it. In my opinion if youâ€™re fussy about noise or easily disturbed then it will annoy you eventually even though it didnâ€™t bother me. You can request an even numbered room at reception. Out and about as I mentioned thereâ€™s a Tescos and some convenience stores on Lehman St.Lehman st had several cafÃ©â€™s and take awayâ€™s serving full breakfast to sandwichâ€™s.Lehmans cafÃ© on Lehman St did excellent full English for Â£4.75,sadly though most places closed on Sundays. Several pubs in the area included the Brown Bear on Lehman St, and the Princess of Persuia.Both was localâ€™s pubs and we found the friendly and welcoming. There were also a Weatherspoons and many bars around Minnories which were fine but very busy when the City workers clocked off their shift. There were also loads of Indian restaurants dotted about but Iâ€™ve never sampled any so I canâ€™t say if they are any good. All in all then. Not too bad. If you can get this hotel at a reasonable price then its quite good value for central London. Itâ€™s not 5 stars but on the flip side itâ€™s not a doss house either. If you consider the other options of a slightly tidier travel lodge practically next door but for Â£30 extra a night or a premier Inn also very near for an extra Â£70 a night I know which option Iâ€™d choose. Aldgate east Travel lodge.But if your quite fussy,a bit nervous about the dark or dont mind paying for a view of a main road instead of a back road then maybe here isnt for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Jannie_X
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about the location of the Hotel as I thought we would be disturbed by noise from trains, but this was not the case. Double glazing and improved tracks means that the trains glide noiselessly by - I didn't hear a single screech and we were in the room during the morning rush hour. The room was spotless and the bathroom spacious and clean. Unusually for a Travelodge we had a bath - we are used to shower rooms only in this chain of Hotels. The staff are extremely helpful and made us very welcome. A remote control was missing from our room but they very quickly provided one when we asked. I did not find the location too intimidating; the stretch of road underneath the arches linking the Hotel to nearby Tower Bridge has all night valeting garages, so I felt as though I had company and the area was not completely deserted. I would definitely stay here again - such a hidden gem and so convenient for bus and tube routes into the West End of London.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, be prepared”
Reviews.Author: motherwellgirl
Reviews.Content: Backs onto a railway line, which they warn you about on the site but so so noisy. Trains going till well after midnight and start at around 6am. Other than that, one of the more decent travelodges Ive stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: mick023
Reviews.Content: We have rarely stayed at Travelodges and this did not encourage us to add to our experience. The hotel is in a dingy area of London, a reasonable walk from tube stations.For some rooms, one has to pass through an outside alleyway which runs under some victorian railway arches. Staff were friendly and efficient. Our room was passable, but our daughter and son-in-law were placed in a room next to the busy railway line and they hardly managed any sleep. It may be cheap, but our experience, would lead us not to return. We would prefer to spend extra on somewhere which did not include the negative points mentioned above. Michael.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a reasonable price also eat at the crypt!”
Reviews.Author: sean j
Reviews.Content: me and my friends went on a trip from Wales to a festival at old billingsgate last weekend and this travel lodge is a good place to stay as you have a lot of facilities around you, a short walk from st Katherine dock and the tower bridge and the tower of london. also a lot of restaurants nearby for anyone who favours the Indian cuisine. down the road from the tube station. also nearby is a little pub called the crypt just a street over opposite the grange tower bridge hotel. they have amazing breakfast which is freshly cooked and is one of the best breakfast i have ever had to date. also the atmosphere in the night is amazing, the staff are very friendly and chatty which gives you a great sense of feeling at home. so if your nearby give the crpyt a go and i assure you it will be better than the weatherspoons across the road

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Karen325
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms here many months ago for myself & 3 friends going to a conference. I later read lots of very poor reviews which did give me cause to worry what to expect. I felt responsible as I had chosen it. We found the lodge very easily, walking approximately 10 mins from the underground. We were greeted and checked in by Mags. He was extremely pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean and with a good hot shower. In the morning, we all enjoyed a 'more than adequet' breakfast. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Nathan J
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, was very dubious about staying here. But never the less the first day we arrived, we saw the dark alley and were abit worried about walking back at night, whihc turned out to be fine as we arrived back each night after 10pm and found no one around and the area seemed very safe! The rooms were also pleasantly surprising been clean and nice, shame about the Aircon though but the fan created a nice movement. Friendly helpful staff too. the trains can cause a problem when watching TV but if the windows are closed the sound isn't too bad and you can sleep. Even in the day my girlfriend and I could sleep until 10am without been awoken by a train. Although the shower water was very hot - cold every 5 seconds which can be annoying. finally and 3 pm checkin was slightly late as we arrived in london at 2 and just needed a bed atfer travelling but the Tescos and cafe were helpful for wasting time. Close to tube stations too. Overall: Great.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: LelProud
Reviews.Content: Basic as expected. Not that cheap for a Travelodge. A curtain missing in our room letting light in in the morning. Shower running hot and cold. On the plus side, the staff were very nice. Wouldn't stay again or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “No problems just a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tufc1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend and was given a room at the back overlooking the train tracks which did get noisy from about 6.00am onwards. The room itself was great - nice and clean. Location is good with a Wetherspoons and Tesco just a couple of minutes away and the tube station about 5min. I have stayed here before and will do again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal For A Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: ukkylie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel many months ago for the last 5 nights of our European summer vacation. We had been travelling for 4 weeks and by the time we arrived and I was incredibly dubious after re-checking the Trip Advisor reviews and reading what a disaster this place was. Upon arrival at the hotel we were warmly greeted by Chris - our check in was swift and efficient, which was brilliant as we had been travelling all day and wanted to relax. During our check in process Chris turned away 2 different couples who were seeking accommodation as the hotel was fully booked. It amazes me that a hotel can be fully booked - especially a hotel who gets reviews like some I read - either some people exaggerate or some people don't care where they stay - we are not either types of these people! We had booked 2 rooms for our family - one room had a small issue with the lights, however Chris efficiently fixed this for us with no problem at all. Both rooms were comfortable, clean and exactly what you would expect from a chain hotel. The beds were comfortable and yes, the air conditioning is non-existent, however no one in our party found the fans noisy or problematic - on fact it was nice to feel a little bit of air movement in the room. We had our windows open the entire stay and I can say as an exceptionally light sleeper I hardly woke during the night - the only time I recall waking was for people coming and going inside the hotel. It might be different for rooms on the other side of the hotel, but we had no problems. The hotel is located down a dark-ish alleyway but at no time when we were coming and going during the night, did we feel unsafe or scared. It might have something to do with living in London previously and knowing that dark areas don't necessarily mean dangerous areas. The only complaint I would make is our room had absolutely no hanging space for clothes which is a pain when you are there for 4 or 5 days. The location of the hotel is excellent - it's within a 5 minute walk of the DLR and the Tube and a 7 or 8 minute walk from the Tower of London! There is free wifi in the bar area albeit it is slow. But it's ideal if you just want to check your emails and do some light surfing. We can also highly recommend the local Witherspoons for great and affordable breakfasts, lunches or dinners - they also have free wifi. All in all, if you can get the cheaper super-save rates, then I honestly don't think you have much to complain about - there is no where else in London you can get a room for 20 quid a night!

Reviews.Title: “noisy location”
Reviews.Author: missfleur
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location as far as sightseeing goes but awful if you intend to get any sleep.odd numbered rooms are about 5 yards away from a very noisy railway line which runs till after midnight and start again at around 5am.its also down a very dark back lane next to the railway arches.i did not feel safe walking down there in the dark.the even numbered rooms are on the side of a busy main road which does get quieter as the night waers on but you can still hear the railway from the other side,although you dont get the vibration from it here.the rooms are clean and comfortable.and cheap...but id rather pay 5 times as much for some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Will avoid again if possible”
Reviews.Author: BritLithcouple
Reviews.Content: Whilst very convenient for City of London meetings, and I have to say clean and well presented with helpful staff, my stay was ruined by the noise from trains running into and out of Fenchurch Street station. The back of the hotel is within a few yards/metres of the tracks. Given also that the air conditioning was disabled but it was a warm night, the need to open the window did not help. Even when shut there was almost constant squealing of train wheels, with a lull somewhere between 01.30 and 04.30 If it wasnt for what is behind this hotel, it would be a very acceptable place to stay. But they are not about to move Fenchurch Street station any time soon, I suspect.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel - too hot and too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: MrsHiggins_86
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel, check in was quick and easy. We went up to our room and were immediately hit by the heat of the room. The windows had been left open but with no air conditioning, the heat was unbearable. We looked out of the window at our view of the DLR and a dead bird and heard a train go past. At this distance from the DLR the trains were really loud. The trains ran well after midnight and started up again at 5.30 in the morning. We had to close the windows to try and deaden the noise (with no great effect) but this meant the room was even hotter! There was a fan in the room but we couldn't leave this on overnight as it was also very noisy. All this meant very little sleep for four nights. On the third day of our visit, we didn't need any towels changing etc and I wanted to leave my phone on charge during the day. I left a sign on the door requesting no staff to come in the room that day. As soon as we returned, I noticed straight away that a member of staff had been in the room. Although my phone was still there I felt disgusted that someone had been in the room despite our request and had access to our possessions against my will. I complained to the cleaning staff the next day and requested again for them to not enter our room. We did not receive any apology. It was the last day of our trip and we had pre-paid Â£10 so we could check out of the hotel at 2pm. When we returned to the hotel to pick up our luggage around lunchtime, my key would not work in the door to our room. I went straight to the reception desk to explain my problem and tell them I had the room booked till 2pm. The woman on the counter was very rude and instead of apologising, she said it must have been our fault the key was not working, despite the fact it had worked all week. I was shocked by her 'don't care' attitude and was left feeling very upset and angry. If you haven't already booked, try the Tower Hill Travelodge which is nearer the tube station but just round the corner from this one. We stayed there last year and it was a much better experience. Don't settle on this one because of the price - that is what we did this year - it really isn't worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Strange location”
Reviews.Author: Chen0weth
Reviews.Content: Do not confuse with Travelodge at Aldgate which is seemingly bigger,brighter and in a less surprising location. Aldgate East is the poor relation although the staff there were excellent. There are four floors of rooms (no family rooms...but you wouldn't want your family here), a lift, restaurant serving breakfast and dinner until quite late. Rooms are compact, airconditioning is not working so rooms are equipped with a fan or a heater depending on the season. We were there in August and it was hot even with the fan going all night. Definitely not my favourite Travelodge although it is a fifteen minute walk to Tayyabs in Fieldgate Street, an iconic Pakistani restaurant well worth a visit. Book in advance or you will not get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Accomodation in the centre of London. Not recommended when hot.”
Reviews.Author: DavidtheRave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. The staff were extremely good without exception. Breakfast was self service and eat all you like. The Room was basic, but spotlessly clean and modern. The location is not the smartest part of town, but it is very central. At night, we walked in from Leman street, because it is better-lit and felt safer. The website warns about noise from the Railway yard, but it was much louder than we expected. In hot weather you have a choice, either have the windows open and cope with the noise or shut the windows and cope with the heat. The air conditioning is not used (presumably for cost reasons). All in all, good basic accomodation as long as it's not too hot outside.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible area”
Reviews.Author: Wirral-Squirrel28
Reviews.Content: Horrible area. Hotel is down a quiet, dark alleyway with 24-hour garages under railway arches. It looks like the setting to Grand Theft Auto. Our taxi driver said he couldn't understand why anyone would ever build a hotel there. That says it all. The top surface of the bedside table was damaged due to past guests repeatedly using it to prepare lines of cocaine on it by the looks of it. I wouldn't recommend staying there to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travelodge in London...”
Reviews.Author: Taliebum
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are regular visitors to London, we usually go 2 or 3 times a year and will stay in a Travelodge hotel more often than not. The thought process behind this being that you always know what to expect with the Travelodge, and we're never in our room much anyway. Aldgate East Travelodge is easy to get to on the tube, the nearest stop being the 'Aldgate East' station, naturally. This station will link you up with the District and Hammersmith & City lines which can get you to anywhere with a few changes here and there. From the tube it is a 5 minute walk to the hotel, once you've sussed where it is. We took a taxi from Kings Cross Station to the hotel (Â£15) when we got there which is a good thing really as the hotel is pretty much located in a random back lane with no signposting. I really think we would have struggled to find it on our own. We did however save a little money by getting the tube back to Kings Cross when we were leaving. So yeah, very strange location as it is not on a main road. This also makes it a little scary when coming back to the hotel on an evening as it is dark and the area in general is very quiet. I would therefore advise single travellers to take care as Aldgate has got a bit of a reputation for being a 'dodgy' area, or so the locals told us! Check-in was quick and easy and there is a small elevator in reception and a few vending machines. There was also a bar/restaurant area offering a wide range of meals, and a smaller late night menu which offered food until the wee hours of the morning. Our room was pretty much the bog standard Travelodge set up, double bed with two small tables either side. Directly opposite we had a long table with the TV on it, a desk and chair area with large mirror for getting dressed and a few drawers. There was also a decent sized wardrobe with a safe inside that did not work. The bathroom comprised shower, toilet, sink and was basic but fairly clean. We visited in June so it was just starting to get warm, and our room was very stuffy. We noticed the air conditioning panel on the wall but could not get it to work so queried this at reception. We were then advised that the hotel did not offer air con and this had been a feature installed by the previous hotel owners that had now been made redundant.. great! We were then encouraged to ventilate our room by leaving the window open all day so that by the time we got back on an evening the room would be cool. I found this to be astounding, we were on the 6th floor so the chances of anyone breaking in via the window were obviously minimal but stranger things have happened. At night it was so warm that we had to leave the window open, and because it opened inwards it meant the pointed edge of the metal frame was hanging over my side of the bed. This of course proved to be disastrous in the middle of the night when I got up to use the toilet and impaled the side of my body on the jagged edge leaving me with a bleeding wound and a scar that is still here. Disgraceful!! Needless to say I have made a formal written complaint about this. Also, because we had to leave the window open it meant we had to suffer immense disruption and noise from the nearby national train station. Luckily, I'm a very deep sleeper but my friend barely slept at all. All in all the experience would have been probably been rated 'Average' had it not been for the temperature issue and the window incident. Those who live in countries where air con comes as standard would probably find it very uncomfortable so should definitely consider finding alternative accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Travel Lodge at its worst”
Reviews.Author: Tim_H_from_Lincs_UK
Reviews.Content: To start with the good points, it was very cheap for central London and the rooms were typical Travel Lodge: clean and basic. The staff were also pleasant and helpful. It's well located for the tube. Everything else was disasterous. Our room was literally 10 metres from a railway track. Great for trainspotters, but nobody else. The noise was terrible. The airconditioning didn't work, so the rooms were baking and if you opened the windows the noise of trains became unbearable. The room safes didn't work and the hotel refused to look after our luggage for the day after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “In truth? What we expected . . .”
Reviews.Author: NGB_May2007
Reviews.Content: Bearing in mind the el-cheapo building materials used to fit out the buildings they acquire, and the "throw it in" contruction methods used, I suspect it'll be rare, if ever, that you get a room that has nothing requiring attention or needs to be replaced. Our room was no different with a fairly long list of wear and tear snags that needed sorting. Having said that, it was OK for the one night my daughter and I stayed. Focussing on the plus side: Bed linen was all clean and freshly laundered. Ensuite was fully functional with plenty of hot water - correct number of towels provided. Free WiFi in the room (although I never tested it). Tea & coffee facilities were in the room Modern flat screen TV and remote provided. A digital lock safe was provided. Efficient check in service (the Receptionist immediately offered to change our room when we commented that that the previous occupant had covered the smoke alarm in order to smoke in it). Located five minutes walk from the Tower of London, Tower Hill tube and Fenchurch St station. Basic menu available in the cafe on the groundfloor throughout the day. Breakfast was fine (for us anyway). I can't understand the comment of one of the previous posters describing it as inedible, as most of it was pre-packed stuff - Kellogs cornflakes are Kellogs cornflakes, sliced bread is sliced bread, baked beans are baked beans. Possibly not top of the range ingredients, but this ain't the Ritz or Savoy and in my experience what was offered was no different from the London four star hotel I stayed in recently. At the end of the day, this is basic two star-ish accommodation with a comensurate price tag. Bearing in mind it's location, at Â£70 a night for a twin with breakfast I don't think there are too many grounds for a grouch.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, noisy, uncomfortable - beware!”
Reviews.Author: doneroaming81
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time I've stayed here but it will be the last. When I first started using this hotel option of air con/ heater control panel but since this has been turned off (why?!) you now open up the wardrobe and get a small heater and fan chucked in the bottom. Fan is not helpful at night as so noisy but then you can't open the window as either road noise or DLR noise. It's a shame really as the room itself feels like a hotel room and is not the usual travelodge style. Not a nice area for a hotel either. Put extra double glazing on to block out the noise (as is done at Tower Hill) and put the air con back on and you might finally get some happy guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Disaster”
Reviews.Author: o0GlobeTrotter0o
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights in a single room. The single room was a disaster. Overlooking 6 railway tracks, at the end of the corridor directly where the (only) lift door is, this room was the noisiest and most uncomfortable I have ever endured. Trains started running at 05:30 every 30 seconds. The bed was barely big enough for a child let alone an adult. The shower was cold because the taps had been vandalised. The room safe was disabled, for no reason. As was the air conditioning. If you were too hot/cold the sign advised that you should get a fan or heater from reception. Excuse me? In the middle of the floor there was a large suspicious brown stain. No attempt had been made to disguise it. Finally, the breakfast. This was a joke - nothing edible at all on offer. So I cancelled the rest of my stay and moved the 200m around the corner to the Premier Inn which was cleaner, better equipped and cheaper. Travelodge, you should be ashamed of your Aldgate East operation.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkGringo
Reviews.Content: Excellent value on a Friday night and in walking distance to the Royal Festival Hall ( 2.5 miles ) Room clean and staff efficient. Stay let down by air conditioning and safe both having been decommissioned, didnt bother me but does tarnish image of hotel. One downside to the location is close proximity to railway lines makes for an interesting early morning call. As others have mentioned the entrance to Chamber Street from Mansell Street does look unsalubrious. Although at midnight I didnt feel threatend. Besides the local amenities mentioned in the previous review I'd also mention a Tescos Express on Mansell Street and the Princess of Prussia on Leman Street an authentic and traditional London pub.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel for the Royal wedding stay”
Reviews.Author: RayGB
Reviews.Content: Travelodge London Aldgate East Hotel 28th & 29th April. Down in London for the Royal wedding...the hotel was easy to find, the room was a family size to sleep 3 with a pull out couch...Very clean with a tea & coffee making facility, It is a clean hotel rooms off corridors..its got slot machine drinks dispencers. Eating facilities.. can be found within an easy walk. But everything in London comes at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, but some may find location a bit iffy”
Reviews.Author: thecoaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in April on a short break to London. On the plus side: -This Travelodge is just 5 mins from Tower Hill tube and attractions like Tower of London/ London Bridge etc -Rooms are ok size/ decor is ok. On the minus side: -The air conditioning rumbled away, but didnt seam to output any cool air. So the room was very hot, but they did provide an electric desk fan. -We were on the railway side of the building, and the passing trains were loud. Although didnt stop me from sleeping, but if you are a light sleeper, please be aware. -The locaction may be of concern to some. Whilst it is 5 mins from busy locations such as the tube and tower of london, the last 2 minutes is down a very quiet street, from one end approached under a tunnel section. I was ok and didnt feel particularly bothered, but if you are a single travellor, this may be of concern. You can walk a slightly longer way and approach from the 'Leman Street' end of Chambers Street to avoid the darker end of Chambers street. On the plus side, a few of the lock ups on the street are 24 hour car wash/ valets so at least there are a few people around keeping an eye out. If you wish to stay in this area, the Tower Hill travelodge is nearer the tube and avoids the Chambers Street quiet dodgy approach. If you are wishing to stay somewhere in london and it doesnt matter where I have stayed at the Southwalk travelodge which offers better accommodation, or the City Road one. Both these are better accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “the noise of the trains are a bother”
Reviews.Author: carm250753
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Tower Bridge. Tower Hill Underground station just 5 minutes away- very convenient. The tunnel which so many people complain about can be easily avoided using Magdalen Passage. Room spacious and clean. BUT: trains passed just under my window and therefore too noisy. Windows had to be closed and room was stuffy and warm . Breakfast is expensive and items that finish are not replaced:one day we had English Breakfast tea missing (In England!?!) then the next day it was the croissants. Otherwise staff are friendly and cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money on this location”
Reviews.Author: Stoffelino
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room as a solo traveller and it was spacious for it's price. The room was really tidy and had a clean bathroom. The breakfast was well worth the seven pounds and the staff was friendly. It'l located next to a train station and that could be a noise problem for some travellers, but I slept right trough it. Also the WiFi was rather expensive so I couldn't use the internet on my laptop. Great hotel overall. Like all the other Travelodge-hotels I ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, handy for the City”
Reviews.Author: csg121
Reviews.Content: You can't really argue with Â£42 for a twin room in the city. Room was basic but clean. We didn't find it too noisy although walls are very thin! Would definately stay here again if we got the same deal. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location if you need to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeskyFly
Reviews.Content: Location felt a bit dodgy, walked there and felt very uneasy. Get a cab if you are staying here. Right on the train line so can be a bit noisy. I wouldn't go back, there must be better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Next visit to London if a room available we will be in it,”
Reviews.Author: Myair
Reviews.Content: Two young female pensionsers on another trip to london, our regular travelodge was full so we opped for Algate. i don't know where some of the people who have written about this hotel stayed it was not where we stayed. We arrived 16.00 hrs on a Sunday friendly greeting lovely girl on the desk. We had booked dinner and breakfast in advance for three nights. all info was explained to us including a map of where we were the nearest tube etc (we came by bus ) being sunday the tube was closed. Room (twin) was very clean and tidy, bath sparkled. Plenty tea coffee and milk. Only niggle no extra pillow even when asked next morning. No worries extra towels appeared to bulk up existing pillow. Resturant was clean breakfast nicely cooked and plentiful. orange juice ,cerals,bacon ,sausages ,egg,yojurts etc no worries over approaching the hotel from any angle workmen in garage and wash shop no problems and a friendly Good morning. Hotel staff were excellent cleaner,bar, reception and resturant . Near to the Tower,The london tour buses stop and petticoat lane market will certainly be using this hotel again. Value for money terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lizzylizlizza
Reviews.Content: We booked the room in advance and managed to get a very good rate, less than Â£40 per night. We also booked advanced Breakfast (which was discounted) and were very pleased with the whole experience. This is not a top London hotel, however, the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean, the fixtures were not the newest - but functioned perfectly well, the shower was powerful. Short walk to the tube at Aldgate East, but we used the buses, which were also very close and gave us a chance to see more! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and the service was great. We were given a room on the back, which was good, as the train is very close to the front of the hotel. All in all, great value.

Reviews.Title: “good budget option”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: hotel really isn't in aldgate east, more tower hill. but this used to be a comfort inn in a previous life and is actually a step up from the standard travelodge fare with high ceilings reasonable decor. was reasonably quiet too with a lack of slamming doors found at other travelodges. friendly staff too who were more than happy to provide extra towels and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “good room, weird location”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Cobbley
Reviews.Content: I stay in Travelodges in London around once a week, always on my own dime, and like to vary the location sometimes. So it was a first for me to stay in this one, and I was pleasantly surprised. As an old hand at this, I know better than to expect anything more than basic amenities, but I got the feeling there may have been a recent refurb, and my room and the bathroom was a decent size, clean, looked new-ish, and everything worked. As regards, the view (such as it is) and the railway close by, I'm not bothered at all. It's located in a curious and quite interesting little quarter of the City, and if you've the time to walk around and explore, it's worth it. Look, for 62 quid per night in Zone 1, don't expect great luxury or to be on Park Lane, but I was perfectly happy and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than most other Travelodges”
Reviews.Author: teejay09k
Reviews.Content: As my title says, this Travelodge is actually better than most of the others I've stayed in. The rooms are basic but clean, the bed is comfy and the hotel is secure. You always get people that complain about the lack of facilities at a Travelodge such as lack of toaster, phone, hairdryer etc but I really do question if they've actually bothered to research the brand at all. Travelodges are BUDGET accommodation and should only be used as a bed for the night, not a weeks luxury break. If you want extra towels, pillows or a hairdryer go and ask - don't wait til you get home and moan on trip advisor about it!

Reviews.Title: “Thank god I only had to stay one night”
Reviews.Author: 186259Donna
Reviews.Content: I have had to stay at this hotel twice in the last month. I arrived late at night (11pm) on both occasions and from Minories Car Park, had to walk up a very dodgy and scary dark lane - not suitable for females travelling on their own. The staff were not friendly or welcoming atall. I'd been driving for 5 hours, it was freezing and snowing. When I got to my room the heating was not working. I asked reception for a panel heater and was told "there is only this blow heater - and we're full so I can't move you". I can't fault the room and the bed was very comfortable (but there was no additional bedding available even though it was so cold). The bathrooms however, have seen better days. Chipped tiles, stained grouting, toilet lever broken, shower head broken etc. On my second visit the lift wasn't working. The noise from the train station was a given - but the noise inside the hotel was awful. People running up and down the corridor, talking loudly, banging doors - at regular intervals during the night. - and no phone to call reception to complain. Not a good nights sleep atall. I paid Â£89 a night for that. Horrendous value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful location, terrible service, railway outside your window”
Reviews.Author: Mina8600
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? The rooms were clean and decent, but that is the best thing that could be said for this hotel. The service was absolutely awful. The staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. Apparently toilet paper is an optional amenity because ours was not always replaced. We stayed 5 nights and were routinely given one towel instead of two. We had to go down to reception every night and get a second towel. There are no phones and and when we asked where the closest pay phone was, the guy didn't know and then said rather rudely "Don't you have phones?" Well, yes we do, but we were from out of the country and couldn't use them. The location was also terrible. Very few restaurants in the vicinity. A 10 minute walk to the subway. We had several sets of train tracks outside our window, which made it difficult to fall sleep (even with earplugs), and I was wakened at 7:00 am every morning by trains going by. If you value sleep, toilet paper, and having your own towel, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints from us - great value for price paid”
Reviews.Author: foxystoat1
Reviews.Content: Booked a Friday night visit to London on business at relatively short notice. After looking at reviews, and the cost on the Travelodge website (Â£45 for twin room), decided to go for it, together with the pre-paid all you can eat breakfast, bringing the price including credit card surcharge to Â£60.75, still very good for central London. So, what was it like? Followed the advice and walked down from Aldgate East tube station (thanks to those on this site for suggesting this route). Agree, slightly dim setting in a very dim side street, but warm welcome at reception,w ho allocated a ground floor room in the adjoining block, facing the road (not the railway...more later...) Certainly a spacious room (Room 5) , slighly more so than other Travelodge rooms I have stayed in, with iron, safe, big wardrobe, flat screen TV, Tea/coffee making facilities. Large bathroom, certainly no issues with the water going hot/cold in our room. The towels were a bit tired admittedly, but not to the detriment of our visit. Ample vending facilities around the reception, and a bar too (didn't try out) The nights sleep was OK, mattress slightly firm, and the room facing the road was a godsend, no noise from the trains as others have complained of on here.Only noise I did hear was drunken singing from people returning tot he hotel at 5am (certainly, no traffic noise) Breakfast in the morning was very nice, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, beans and tomatoes available as cooked option, or standard pre-packed small boxed of cereal available, together with toasts, yoghurts, juices, many flavoured teas too. Like the airy, spacious dining area too. Check out was swift and friendly. Certainly no issues experienced by other reviews. Would certainly stay here again given the choice. 6/7 stations away from Oxford Street might mean there are closer options if you're visiting for shopping, but certainly worth considering if you're on business in The City/Docklands area

Reviews.Title: “A decent, good value hotel - as long as you ask for a room far from the train line”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 2 nights with two colleagues. It is a 10 minute walk up to Aldgate East tube and further from Tower Hill, worth bearing in mind if you have plenty of luggage. From the Tower Hill side, it also involves walking down a dark road with tunnels off to one side - not the nicest walk if you are on your own in the dark! The reception area looks to have been recently spruced up and the staff were quick and efficient. The room I was allocated was at the front of the hotel and was what you would typically expect from a Travelodge, aside from a big fist sized dent in the wardrobe and a shower head which needed to be fixed whilst I was out. After an evening out, we came back to the hotel and I slept very well. However my two colleagues had rooms at the back of the hotel and were woken up by trains whizzing past their windows from 6am - even with the windows closed it was apparently impossible for either of them to get back to sleep... Breakfast was fine: standard Travelodge cafÃ© fare, but there are plenty of cafÃ©s nearby if required.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: casseycc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for a three day break in London. The location was great the staff were friendly, the room and bathroom was clean and tidy what more do you need. What do people have to moan about nothing with this travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Just about adequate.”
Reviews.Author: AntheaDevon
Reviews.Content: Definitely not the best Travelodge I've stayed in. The lobby area was tired and tatty. Room was a reasonable size, as was the bathroom, and although the room itself was reasonably clean, the shower had those awful telltale hairs in the plughole! The hotel is in a convenient location, being just five-ten minutes walk from the Tower of London and Tower Hill underground station, but, as other reviewers have said, the approach to the hotel, along Chamber Street, is very grotty, with rubbish-strewn areas underneath the railway arches. Not a pleasant walk, especially at night. However, you can avoid this: if coming from the Tower direction, walk up Mansell Street and don't turn right into Chamber Street. Walk past it and then take the next right, down the brightly-lit Prescot Street and a short way along there you'll find a little cut-through, back to Chamber Street which is well-lit and perfectly OK to walk down. When you get to Chamber Street, at the end of this little cut-through, you just have to turn left and you'll see the hotel on the opposite side. You will then have missed all the grotty bits of Chamber Street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of last resort”
Reviews.Author: nybor666
Reviews.Content: Stay here only if you really can't find somewhere better. First, the good points: the buffet breakfast was completely satisfactory, and was supervised by an efficient young man who worked quickly to ensure food did not run out. (You may or may not consider the breakfast price of Â£7.50 per head reasonable.) And the windows in the room could be opened a couple of inches, allowing one to breathe instead of suffocate - a point so few corporate hotels get right these days. Traffic noise with the windows open was tolerable. The room was acceptably clean. Now the bad. Surly desk staff (the breakfast man was an exception) with poor English who could not answer questions clearly. Poor location in a dodgy alley (though just a short distance from better streets.) Broken air conditioning in the room that just displayed an error message on the controller. A shower that switched from hot to cold and back every few seconds. Broken extractor fan in the bathroom - as is normal in so many British hotels. Somewhat cramped room. Very basic facilities - don't expect even a small piece of soap, and be prepared to share your hand and bath towel. Wi-fi is available but they want Â£5 for an hour's use, which is sheer corporate greed. So if you just need a place to sleep for one night, this will do if you can get a good price and can't get into the much better places nearby. Don't consider it for a stay of several nights and don't expect to get any pleasure out of it.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKINGLY BAD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: RinksEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: The room was basic and tidy which was the only thing going for this place. It's awkward to find...its round the corner from another travelodge on a dodgy lane. The reception staff really werent interested in helping with anything. The room doesnt have a hairdryer but they are available from reception...just dont expect a smile from them! We really got the feeling the staff there were not interested in making the experience pleasant. Which would be fine if it were a cheap deal, but it was over priced for such a shocking lack of service. Also the safes in the room dont work! And check out time is 12, but for the excellent price of ten pounds you can have the room for another 2 hours to store luggage etc. Which is pretty shocking...if you go to Liverpool Street Station there are lockers you can leave luggage for 24 hours for Â£8, much better deal (as long as you dont need the room to showere etc) I thought Â£10 for 2 extra hours was taking the rip personally, but hey ho....my recommendation is not to go here! The lifts werent working either. Generally dissatisfied with both the chain and the service from this hotel. Oh also there was weird plumbing in our room, so when ever someone flushed their toilet we could hear it...and people were up all night flushing...not peoples faults...just didnt allow a good sleep for the lighter sleepers of us :-(

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by the negative reviews on here”
Reviews.Author: matthewandJulie
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night 6th September. I was in London fo a business meeting and because i booked a few weeks in advance paid only Â£25 for the night. Yes the travelodge is difficult to find and the underpass at the end of Chamber street is not very welcoming but you only have a short detour to avoid this and approach on a main road with plenty of traffic and people around The room was clean and comfortable, the air conditioning worked very well. The shower was excellent - plenty of hot water and powerful. The staff were friendly and helpful. My room backed onto the rail tracks but trains do not run all night and i had a good nights sleep. I dont think you will find any budget hotel in London without some kind of traffic noise I didnt use the bar or breakfast facilities, there are plenty of pubs, cafes, fast food and indian restaurants within 2 minutes walk of the front door, cheap breakfast at wetherspoons only 5 minutes away I was worried that they might overbook and I would be moved given i had only paid Â£25, this didnt happen but if it had done the Tower Hill travelodge which i understand people have been moved to in the past is only at the other end of Chamber Street, 5 minutes walk away so it would not have been a massive inconvienience anyway So if you bear in mind that this is a travelodge and not a 5 star hotel and will not offer 5 star facilities I would recomend it to anyone. i would have been happy paying the full rate for the room, Â£25 was a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended for leisure; sleeping”
Reviews.Author: CheeseWizard
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst thing about the stay is that there was dried blood on the duvets in my double room, and the fact that although I asked for a replacement duvet, I didn't get one, meaning I had to endure an evening without a duvet at all. The receptionist / porter was particularly surly and refused to make eye contact when I took it up with him the next day- it seemed that he was inferring that the situation was my fault. The location isn't great, being equidistant from Aldgate station and Aldgate east, and also having its back to a railway track and being situated down a particularly dingy back alley. The room sizes were adequate, but the showers alternated between being scaldingly hot and tepid, all the while changing pressure. The hotel was relatively good value booked far enough in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Janethemidwife
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with friends and would recommend highly it was clean comfy very central to the tourist spots yet tucked away nicely, We had quiet rooms on the other side of the railway track and never heard a thing, the breakfast was pretty good too as its a small hotel the serving dishes are not piled high with greasy bacon , the lift broke as did our aircon on first day but both were promptly mended, for value and location it beats any place I have stayed before in London.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great price- we paid Â£42 for the room for tow people which ocnsidering the location was great. The room was very clean. The staff were pleasant. Breakfast wasn't very good but the rpice was not high so I guess oyu get what you pay for. Next time, I will eat elsewhere but stay here. The price was right, the staff helpful and the room was clean. I did walk the long way round late at night when returning as I did not fancy walking down the alley way.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: muzzSurrey
Reviews.Content: As we were used to staying in the 'fairly new' Tower Hill Travelodge, my partner and myself weren't expecting this hotel to be as good, but we were wrong, as we had a great stay. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room (as always, in the various Travelodges that we have stayed in), were spotlessly clean. Chamber Street looks a bit spooky but it's fine, we didn't feel at all uncomfortable walking through it. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: betskuuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 3 years ago when it was the Comfort Hotel. Despite a few bad reviews i thought i would give it another go. I really don't get people who complain about the location or size of rooms. Its a Travelodge for goodness sake, not the Ritz.. The room was comfortable, there was plenty of hot water and the noise from the railway line was no problem. I've got no complaints at all. So basically if you want to pay between Â£19-Â£49 for a room in London, then this hotel is ideal. If you want a huge room in the centre of London with a view of Nelsons Column, a pool, 24 hour room service and a jacuzzi bathroom, then pay your Â£250 a night and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: nicholas_reed
Reviews.Content: I wasnâ€™t expecting too much having read previous reviews, but the hotel is OK. The location is a bit dead, and I recommend a taxi or tube to more lively areas. But the hotel itself is OK, room was clean, tidy and had all that was needed. Bed was reasonable comfortable. The rest of the hotel is average, service not bad, breakfast below par, bar OK. Itâ€™s all about a cheap room in London, and you get that with minimal fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: LeeBrillo
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 2 nights 18th and 19th May 2010. Found the hotel fairly easily after consulting an A to Z. Two main ways of getting to it from The Tower, one is to go under the railway bridge down Chamber Street which is fine, the arches might be a bit of a problem at night but there seemed to be businesses like car parks and car valeting working all the time. The other way to get there is down Prescot Street to Leman Street then turn right and right again. The staff on reception were very friendly. The lift was quick, slight problem with the doors closing even if you are in between them due to dodgy sensors, quite painful! The room was clean and very modern. A flat screen TV, plenty of tea and coffee supplied. Our room looked out over the Fenchurch Street and DLR railway lines, the noise of the trains wasn't too bad at all. The bathroom was fairly clean and modern, the shower head couldn't be fixed to the wall due to the bracket being broken. Also the taps in the sink were of an odd design. It was one tap which when turned went from cold to hot, trouble is by the time the water was coming out hot the sink was full even with the plug out. We had breakfast in the hotel on the first morning, the only criticism there would be that as soon as 4 or 5 fresh croissants were put out they were gone withing seconds, could have done with more being put out. Went to the Goodmans Fields Wetherspoons for breakfast on the second morning, only a 2 minute walk away. The nearest mini-market we could find was a Tesco on Mansell Street and a Costcutter by Aldgate East station. All in all I found this a great base for exploring London at a good price. We paid Â£49.00 per room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but definitely not cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: AussieWanderlust
Reviews.Content: I checked in late at night just needing to crash after a long day of business meetings. The temperature in my room was set at 26 degrees.. Absolute sauna. and the in room controls were broken. As there are no phones in the room I had to go back downstairs to find someonE to sort this out, which took about 30 mins. When we got it working took an hour to get room to a temperature I could sleep in- around 1 am by now. My tv didn't have a remote. No toiletries in bathroom. And my room overlooked rail lines and the tube, so had commuter trains rattling past from 5 ish. Think I got about 3 hours sleep. Staff were as helpful as they could be- lesson is that you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MassyMassy
Reviews.Content: Down a unlit street, as a solo traveller did not feel particularly safe. Paid Â£59 for a single bed that was next to the lift and the train tracks. Sleep as virtually impossible. In the morning got up early for a nice shower and no hot water. Would not use again. Shame really as I usually have no complaints about Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: frankiwid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Easter weekend for a footy match. Have used TL's all over the country for this purpose including the one at Tower Hill but panicked after booking when we read the reviews. Shouldn't have though as it was sound. As it was Easter the tubes were all disrupted and Aldgate East station was closed so on arrival at St Pancras we were advised to take the tube to Liverpool St and a bus to Aldgate. The 135 bus dropped us at the Algate Exchange pub. We crossed the road and walked along Mansell Street (400 yards). At the junction there is a Weatherspoons pub and you can see Chamber Street. This bit looked dodgy as we had to walk past railway arches and it was a bit grim, but we could see the hotel after 2 minutes. When we found our bearings we found that you can avoid this bit easily, from the Weatherspoons go toward the Premier Inn on Prescott St and turn right into Magdalens Passage, it brings you out at the hotel door. Alternatively, from Aldgate East tube, follow Leman St (400 yards) and turn right into Chamber St at the Brown Bear (another pub! ha). Checkin took all of 2 minutes, the easiest ever. We asked for a quiet room and were given 1 on the 3rd floor at the front of the hotel. The room was bigger than a TL ( as this had prev been a Comfort and maybe in need of a makeover) but it was clean, the bathroom was clean and the shower was powerful with plenty of hot water. We didn't eat here at all but with a Weatherspoons 5 mins away, 2 Indian restaurants at the end of the road and a Tesco opposite spoons you don't need to. It is a 5 minute walk to the Tower of London from here and with 3 tube stations (tube services permitting) you have easy access to the rest of London. We got to Arsenal in about 30 minutes on a match day! If you want a base for a few days you can't go wrong with this place, especially if you book well in advance (we paid Â£19 per night, IN LONDON! AT EASTER!) We will definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinytootz
Reviews.Content: Well, to start with, this hotel is a bit of a nightmare to find at the weekend when the tubes are disrupted, as you have to get on the DLR, then off the DLR and back on in the opposite direction! Located on CHAMBER street, not to be confused with CHAMBERS street, which is 1.5 miles over the bridge! Unfortunately, Chamber st is basically an alleyway with garages, so it doesn't feature on many tourist maps or A-Z, and any taxi drivers we asked didn't know where it was either! We ended up at Chambers street, found it was the wrong one, so ended up walking back towards the DLR. Strangely, found the other VERY nearby travelodge first (London Bridge), and the friendly man on the desk pointed us in the right direction, telling us that he has had to do that 20 times already that day! Staff in Aldgate east are friendly enough, lift only seems to go up, not down. Room looked ok on the surface, but wasn't exactly sparkling. The only way to get hot water from the tap is to turn it on full blast and get wet, which is rather annoying! Quite a lot of noise from the DLR, but this is explained on the booking page. Overall, we would rate this hotel 5/10, mainly due to its location, and it didn't have any Wi-Fi access. Great Indian at the end of Chamber street though, and a Wetherspoons!

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Over Booking Policy”
Reviews.Author: extraveg
Reviews.Content: I was shocked when I turned up at this hotel mid evening to be told that the hotel chain has a policy of over booking rooms, and that there was no room for me that night. When I complained I was told that the only room available had a faulty toilet. I am a business traveler and chose this hotel because of it's close proximity to the location of my work - therefore I do not want to be offered an alternative hotel some distance away. I had booked and paid in advance for a room close to my work, therefore the hotel should have had no need to overbook my room. Whether I turned up or not would have made no difference to the hotel as they had already been paid for the room. This is a very poor show in my opinion, evidence of corporate greed, and I would therefore not recommend this hotel chain to anyone - in fact I would actively discourage them.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended.”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveller091
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with previous reviewer, January 2010 heating and hot water still not working properly mid February. Just wish I'd read reviews before travelling, Only one towel provided, although no problems getting one from reception, inconvenience. Very understaffed during breakfast and evening meal time, receptionist running between reception and dining room, checking people out and sorting tables. Very slow replenishing breakfast items, small 2 slice very cheap toaster to be used by every one. Position and directions not very good.

Reviews.Title: “worst travelodge i've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mindmybike
Reviews.Content: bad location down dodgy looking poorly lit side street , I had to cross an alley way to get to my room, kept awake half the night by traffic noise and then the cleaning staff arriving for work. no hot water in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location for a week in London”
Reviews.Author: exlancs65
Reviews.Content: We booked into the hotel on Monday 25th Jan and checked out today, Saturday 30th Jan, and we paid Â£32 per room per night. We arrived at 14:55 and were told to wait until 15:00 before we could check in. This was OK as we knew the rules. We found the room was a good size, and the shower was very good indeed - a full-on power shower! There was a flat screen colour TV in the room. One slight gripe was one of the bedside lamps was on an angle because a screw had come out, but it worked and we didn't feel the need for a replacement. One day, the cleaners did not leave a toilet roll or replacement milks for the drinks, but we simply asked for these at reception and we were given them. The room has three pillows, so ask for an extra one when you check in. They are on the thin side so you will probably need two per person. Chamber Street is a quiet street and is easily reachable without going below any dark arches! It is a 10-minute walk to either Tower Hill, Aldgate or Aldgate East underground stations, or a 5-minute walk to a number 15 bus which takes you direct into the heart of London, i.e. Trafalgar Square, Piccadilly etc. I completely agree with a previous reviewer who recommends Tesco for snacks, nibbles and wine (a 5-minute walk away and with a Link ATM), and also the local J D Wetherspoon (Goodman's Fields) for breakfasts and other meals. We have used the Aldgate East Travelodge twice now and will definitely use it again - I have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fit for the purpose”
Reviews.Author: Aerosmithfan
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what some previous reviewers are moaning about. It's a Travelodge in Aldgate, for heaven's sake - if you want the Four Seasons in Kensington, pay for it! The terms and conditions say you can't check in before 2.30, so that's the deal. Handy hints: Approach the hotel via Leman Street, and turn left. Ask for a room at the front of the hotel. We did, and heard no noise at all, not even from other guests on our corridor. Don't get the hotel breakfast, go to the Wetherspoons pub about 5 minutes walk away. Go to Tesco Express just over the road from Wetherspoons for water, in-room snacks, wine etc. The staff were friendly and helpful, probably because we approached them in a positive frame of mind. The room was very clean and functional. I've had a lot worse bathrooms in higher-priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “not even worth the Â£49”
Reviews.Author: TyrianFitzroy
Reviews.Content: we got to london - staying for a week. -3degrees outside and snowing. we got to the hotel 15 mins before check in and were greeted with "the rooms redy but you still cant check in til 3"... ok maybe its hotel policy. we get to the room and its ok.. what you pay for, small, not nice but decent. We spent our first night there only to find the heating didnt work and the hot water didnt work. We went to reception thinking its just our room.
